content.question: Which of the following best describes why the engineer chose to calculate the permeability of the soil sample in the experimental design in order to evaluate a natural containment system to protect groundwater?

choices.label: Soils that have high permeability would best help protect groundwater because they would allow for faster recharge of the aquifer.
Soils that have high permeability would best help protect groundwater because they have higher rates of nutrient and pesticide leaching.
Soils that have low permeability would best help protect groundwater because the soil traps pollutants so that chemical and biological breakdown can occur.
Soils that have low permeability would best help protect groundwater because the large pore spaces would provide space for pollutants to attach and would have rapid percolation of water.

content.answer: Soils that have low permeability would best help protect groundwater because the soil traps pollutants so that chemical and biological breakdown can occur.
